article.headline: Fresno State 89, Idaho 54
article.story: FRESNO, Calif. (AP) -- Ja'Vance Coleman shot 6 of 8 behind the arc -- all in the first half -- and finished with a game-high 22 points to lead Fresno State to a 89-54 victory over Idaho on Monday night. Fresno State (11-8, 4-4 Western Athletic Conference) finished 14 of 28 from the 3-point line, tying the Save Mart Center record. The Bulldogs shot 53.4 percent overall. Quinton Hosley added 14 points, eight rebounds and four blocks for the Bulldogs, who led by as much as 44 points in handing Idaho (3-15, 0-7) its ninth consecutive loss. The Vandals have not won since a 76-71 victory over North Dakota State on Dec. 21. Idaho, which shot 33.9 percent and less than 35 percent for the fifth time this season, got 11 points from Tanoris Shepard and 10 from Brett Ledbetter. Fresno State pulled away midway through the first half, holding Idaho to two field goals over 12 minutes during a 27-5 run. The Bulldogs led 45-23 at halftime. Fresno State owned a 41-26 rebounding edge and finished with 10 blocks and 22 assists.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
